meanings.definition: The broadcasting of a radio or television program.
meanings.sent1: The airplay of the show reached many listeners.
meanings.sent2: The radio station increased its airplay by adding more music variety.
meanings.sent3: The airplay of the news program kept the audience informed.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had such airplay that it resonated with everyone who listened.
meanings.sent5: The airplay of the sports event made it feel like you were there in person.

meanings.definition: The act of playing a song on the radio.
meanings.sent1: The popular song received heavy airplay on all stations.
meanings.sent2: The DJ decided to give the new song some airplay during rush hour.
meanings.sent3: The airplay of the song caused everyone to start dancing.
meanings.sent4: His voice had such airplay that it captured the hearts of many listeners.
meanings.sent5: The catchy tune got so much airplay that it became a hit in no time.

meanings.definition: The amount of time a song is played on the radio.
meanings.sent1: The song's airplay increased after it won an award.
meanings.sent2: The artist was thrilled to hear their song getting more airplay.
meanings.sent3: The airplay of the song lasted for weeks on end.
meanings.sent4: The song's airplay was so long that it became everyone's favorite.
meanings.sent5: The continuous airplay of the song made it impossible to forget.
